Akira.name: USS Gryphon
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Elaine Mello. Assigned to defend Deep Space Nine for a short period of time after the Dominion War in the Deep Space Nine relaunch.[citation needed]

Akira.name: USS James T Kirk
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Elias Vaughn. Named in honor of the famous Starfleet captain. Destroyed in the defense of Federation worlds against the mass Borg invasion of 2381, resulting in the death of 31 crew members and Captain Vaughn being left brain dead.

Akira.name: USS Rabin
Akira.depiction: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.[2]

Akira.name: USS Thunderchild
Akira.depiction: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001 in 2373.[2]

Akira.name: USS Geronimo
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Gregory McCray; Major supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander.

Akira.name: USS Leyte Gulf
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Aaron Juraj; first Starfleet vessel to be infected by nanites in Star Trek: Away Team.

Akira.name: USS Dakota
Akira.depiction: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001 in 2373.[2] Lost patrolling the border of the Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.[3]

Akira.name: USS Devore
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Joshua Martin; Supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander.

Akira.name: USS Delestrez
Akira.depiction: Commanded by Captain Juliette; Supporting ship in Celestia Universe.

Akira.name: USS Summit
Akira.depiction: Attempts to rescue the Enterprise-E on Gemworld. Destroyed by a dimensional rift immediately after dropping out of warp. Lost with all hands.[citation needed]

Ambassador.name: USS Adelphi
Ambassador.depiction: Crew made first contact with the Ghorusda.[4]

Ambassador.name: USS Enterprise
Ambassador.depiction: Commanded by Captain Rachel Garrett presumed to be Killed In Action when the ship was destroyed defending the Klingon outpost at Narendra III from Romulan attack.[5] HelmsmanRichard Castillo assumed command of the Enterprise-C in 2366 and returned to the year 2344 where the ship was destroyed defending the Klingon outpost.

Ambassador.name: USS Excalibur
Ambassador.depiction: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6] Later commanded by Captain Mackenzie Calhoun in Star Trek: New Frontier.

Ambassador.name: USS Exeter
Ambassador.depiction: Tom Paris's assignment before being dismissed from Starfleet.[7] Participated in the Dominion War.[8] Later commanded by Captain Elizabeth Shelby, followed by Captain Alexandra Garbeck in Star Trek: New Frontier.

Ambassador.name: USS Gandhi
Ambassador.depiction: Ship to which Thomas Riker is assigned.[9][10]

Ambassador.name: USS Horatio
Ambassador.depiction: Commanded by Captain Walker Keel.[11] Destroyed by agents of an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet.[11]

Ambassador.name: USS Valdemar
Ambassador.depiction: Sent to the border of the Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.[3]

Ambassador.name: USS Yamaguchi
Ambassador.depiction: Destroyed by the Borg at the Battle of Wolf 359.[12]

Ambassador.name: USS Zhukov
Ambassador.depiction: Made cultural observation of Alpha Laputa IV.[13] Previous assignment of Lt. Barclay before transfer to the Enterprise-D[14] Supporting ship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander, commanded by an Andorian Captain Verata, the ship escorts the USS Sovereign to Starbase 12 and participates in several battles.

Andromeda.name: USS Drake
Andromeda.depiction: Ambushed by a Klingon battle squadron.[15]

Andromeda.name: USS Prokofiev
Andromeda.depiction: Dispatched to the border of the Federation-Cardassian Demilitarized Zone.[3]

Antares.name: USS Antares aka SS Antares
Antares.depiction: Rescued and is later destroyed by Charlie Evans.[16]

Antares.name: USS Hermes
Antares.depiction: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Apollo.name: USS Agamemnon
Apollo.depiction: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6] Part of "Task Force 3" sent to face an anticipated Borg Attack[17]

Apollo.name: USS Ajax
Apollo.depiction: Cortin Zweller's first assignment.[18] Received experimental warp drive technology.[19] Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Apollo.name: USS Clement
Apollo.depiction: Scheduled to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D.[20]

Apollo.name: USS Gage
Apollo.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21]

Archer.name: USS Archer
Archer.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class. Presumably named for Jonathan Archer

Archer.name: USS Huang Zhong
Archer.depiction: Mentioned in the tie-in novel Star Trek: Seekers #4: All That's Left. Crashed on a planet in a spatial rift. Crew rescued by the Enterprise resulting in first contact with the Dolysians.

Archer.name: USS Sagittarius
Archer.depiction: Commanded by Clark Terrell prior to taking command of the USS Reliant. Assigned to explore the Taurus Reach. Presumably named for the constellation.

Bradbury.name: USS Bradbury
Bradbury.depiction: Scheduled to transport Wesley Crusher to Starfleet Academy and undergoes warp drive performance tests.[22][23]In Star Trek Into Darkness, Spock was to be reassigned to another Bradbury following Kirk's demotion from Captain of the Enterprise. In the end, he was reinstated to the Enterprise.[24]

Centaur.name: USS Centaur
Centaur.depiction: Centaur class: kitbash of the Excelsior and Miranda models.[25]

Challenger.name: USS Armstrong
Challenger.depiction: Ambushed by a Klingon battle group. Name honors astronaut Neil Armstrong, commander of Apollo 11.

Challenger.name: USS Buran
Challenger.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21]

Cheyenne.name: USS Ahwahnee
Cheyenne.depiction: Heavily damaged at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21] Presumed repaired to participate in the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Chimera.name: USS Portland
Chimera.depiction: Searches the Algira sector for Odo and Elim Garak when their runabout goes missing.[27]

Columbia.name: USS Endeavour
Columbia.depiction: Originally the last active NX class starship in the Earth Starfleet. Transferred to Federation Starfleet service and rebuilt into the first Columbia class starship.

Constellation.name: USS Gettysburg
Constellation.depiction: Under Captain Mark Jameson, rescued hostages from Mordan IV.[31] Served in the Dominion War.[32]

Constellation.name: USS Hathaway
Constellation.depiction: Decommissioned, participated in exercises against the USS Enterprise-D. Its destruction was faked in a ruse to foil Ferengi attackers. Named for the wife of William Shakespeare.[1][33]

Constellation.name: USS Magellan
Constellation.depiction: Referred to by Captain Sisko as one of the ships to protect the USS Defiant's flank[34]

Constellation.name: USS Stargazer
Constellation.depiction: Jean-Luc Picard's first command.[35] Abandoned following the Battle of Maxia, later recovered by Starfleet.[35]

Constellation.name: USS Victory
Constellation.depiction: Ship on which Geordi La Forge once served.[36][37] Participated in the Dominion War.[38] Named after the Napoleonic Wars British Royal Navy flagship, HMS Victory captained by Horatio Nelson, 1st Viscount Nelson

Constitution.name: USS Constellation
Constitution.depiction: Commanded by Commodore Matthew Decker. All of crew was killed by the Doomsday Machine except for Commodore Decker.[39] Used as a bomb to destroy the planet-killer.

Constitution.name: USS Defiant
Constitution.depiction: The ship is lost in an interdimensional rift in "The Tholian Web".[40] Later, it is revealed she was taken by Mirror Universe Tholians, captured by the crew of ISS Enterprise (NX-01), and then used in the service of the Terran Empire in "In a Mirror, Darkly".[41] The Defiant is mentioned, but not seen (except for a wireframe graphic) in Star Trek Discovery, Season One.

Constitution.name: ISS Enterprise
Constitution.depiction: Mirror Universe version of the USS Enterprise in "Mirror, Mirror".[42]

Constitution.name: USS Enterprise
Constitution.depiction: Commanded by Robert April (2245–2250), Christopher Pike (2250–2265), James T. Kirk (2265-2270, 2273–2280, 2285), Willard Decker (2270-2273, ship's commander during refit up to V'Gerincident), and Spock (2280-2285, at which time Enterprise was assigned to Starfleet Academy as a training ship). Vessel's self-destruction carried out while in orbit of the Genesis Planet to prevent ship from falling into Klingon hands.[43]

Constitution.name: USS Enterprise(Kelvin Timeline)
Constitution.depiction: Originally commanded by Christopher Pike (launched 2258), then James T. Kirk.[44] Destroyed by Krall in 2263.[45]

Constitution.name: USS Enterprise(Kelvin Timeline)
Constitution.depiction: Replacement for USS Enterprise launched in 2263.[45]

Constitution.name: USS Excalibur
Constitution.depiction: Severely damaged and crew killed during Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test.[46]

Constitution.name: USS Exeter
Constitution.depiction: All crew lost (killed by alien disease) except for Captain Ronald Tracey, who was on the planet's surface when the disease struck his crew.[47]

Constitution.name: USS Farragut
Constitution.depiction: Ship on which James Kirk served as a phaser station operator.[48] Attacked by the dikironium cloud creature, which killed half the crew.[48] The ship never appeared on screen and was never given a class or registry number; both come from The Star Trek Encyclopedia.[1]

Constitution.name: USS Hood
Constitution.depiction: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test.[46]

Constitution.name: USS Intrepid
Constitution.depiction: All-Vulcan crew destroyed by a massive, spacegoing single-celled life form.[49]

Constitution.name: USS Lexington
Constitution.depiction: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test. Commanded by Commodore Robert Wesley[46]

Constitution.name: USS Potemkin
Constitution.depiction: Participates in Richard Daystrom's M5 computer test.[46]

Constitution.name: USS Paris
Constitution.depiction: Destroyed in The Battle Of Caleb IV.

Deadalus.name: USS Archon
Deadalus.depiction: Destroyed by alien computer in 2167 near Beta III.[58]

Deadalus.name: USS Essex
Deadalus.depiction: Damaged and crashed on Mab-Bu VI.[60]

Deadalus.name: USS Horizon
Deadalus.depiction: A model of this ship was on display in the school aboard Deep Space 9 in early 2369. (DS9: "The Nagus")

Deadalus.name: USS Pilgrim
Deadalus.depiction: Active in the year 2159 in the vicinity of one of Starfleet's first starbases. Appears in the Star Trek videogame "Legacy".

Deadalus.name: USS Lovell
Deadalus.depiction: Dedicated vessel of the Starfleet Corps of Engineers. Appears in the novel series Star Trek: Vanguard.Likely named after Capt. James Lovell USN, Gemini and Apollo astronaut.

Deadalus.name: USS Masao
Deadalus.depiction: Dedicated vessel of the Starfleet Corps of Engineers. Mentioned in the tie-in novel Star Trek: Seekers #4: All That's Left.

Deadalus.name: USS Zander
Deadalus.depiction: Dedicated vessel of the Starfleet Corps of Engineers. Mentioned in the tie-in novel Star Trek: Seekers #4: All That's Left.

Defiant.name: USS Defiant
Defiant.depiction: Pathfinder. Assigned to space station Deep Space Nine.[61] Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.[2] Destroyed at the Second Battle of Chin'toka.[62]

Defiant.name: USS Defiant
Defiant.depiction: Formerly the USS São Paulo.[63] Assigned to space station Deep Space Nine.[63] Participates in the Battle of Cardassia.[64]

Defiant.name: USS Saladin
Defiant.depiction: Commanded by Captain Shinoda during the Dominion War in the short story "Safe Harbors".

Defiant.name: USS Valiant
Defiant.depiction: Starfleet Academy Red Squad training ship. The vessel gets caught behind enemy lines after the outbreak of the Dominion War, suffered heavy losses among the standard crew and was subsequently commanded by the cadets of Red Squad. Destroyed by the Jem'Hadar after a failed attempt to destroy a new Dominion Vessel. Only three people survived the destruction of the ship (Jake Sisko, Nog, and Collins, a member of Red Squad).[65]

Defiant.name: USS Monitor
Defiant.depiction: Mentioned in both the books The Return and Preserver, lost under command of Captain John Scott Lewinski attempting to set new warp speed record with recovered Borg transwarp drive.

Deneva.name: USS Arcos
Deneva.depiction: Destroyed by a warp core breach near Turkana IV in 2367. Crew evacuates to the planet's surface and is rescued by the Enterprise-D.[66]

Deneva.name: USS LaSalle
Deneva.depiction: Reports unusual radiation anomalies in the Gamma Arigulon system.[67]

Dreadnought.name: USS Vengeance
Dreadnought.depiction: Developed by Starfleet Admiral Alexander Marcus of Section 31 to combat the Klingon Empire.

Einstein.name: USS Kelvin
Einstein.depiction: In the timeline at the start of the movie Star Trek, the Kelvin was in service with Starfleet in the early 23rd century. In 2233, the Kelvin was under the command of Captain Richard Robau; his first officer was Lieutenant Commander George Kirk. Kirk's wife, Winona, was also aboard the ship at that time while she was pregnant with their son, James T. Kirk. The Kelvin was destroyed by the Romulan mining ship Narada, which arrived from the distant future through an artificial black hole.[44] Named for director J. J. Abrams' grandfather.[68] Its registry number, NCC-0514, comes from Abrams's birthdate of May 14.

Erewhon.name: SS Santa Maria
Erewhon.depiction: Personnel Transport about 4 times the size of the Runabout. Cannibalised for parts and for use as a shelter by human settlers in a colony that rejects technology.[69]

Excelsior.name: USS Al-Batani
Excelsior.depiction: Although it never appeared on screen, the Al-Batani is mentioned in dialogue as the first ship aboard which Kathryn Janeway served, which at the time was captained by Tom Paris' father Owen Paris.[70][71] Never defined on screen, the class and registry number come from the non-canon Star Trek Encyclopedia.[1]

Excelsior.name: USS Berlin
Excelsior.depiction: Patrolled the Romulan Neutral Zone.[72]

Excelsior.name: USS Cairo
Excelsior.depiction: Transfers Captain Edward Jellico to the Enterprise-D.[73]

Excelsior.name: USS Charleston
Excelsior.depiction: Transported three previously cryogenically frozen people to Earth.[74] Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Excelsior.name: USS Crazy Horse
Excelsior.depiction: Part of Task Force 3 sent to face an anticipated Borg invasion.[17] Set to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D to transfer Rear Admiral Erik Pressman.[75]

Excelsior.name: USS Crockett
Excelsior.depiction: Transported Admiral Mitsuya to Deep Space Nine.[69]

Excelsior.name: USS Dallas
Excelsior.depiction: Dedication plaque states "Last starship of her class"[76]

Excelsior.name: USS Enterprise
Excelsior.depiction: Ship aboard which James T. Kirk is lost and presumed dead. First commanded by Captain Jon Harriman.[77]

Excelsior.name: USS Excelsior
Excelsior.depiction: Pathfinder and transwarp drive testbed.[43] In The Search for Spock, the ship was dubbed 'the great experiment' and was days away from its first test run. It was unexpectedly called into service to stop Admiral Kirk and his crew from stealing the soon to be decommissioned Enterprise. Attempting to use the transwarp drive to bring the ship back to spacedock, the Excelsior was sabotaged by Montgomery Scott and was left inoperable. Following the embarrassing failure, the Excelsior underwent repairs in spacedock before its recommission into active duty. Fails in attempt to rescue Captain James T. Kirk and Dr. Leonard McCoy from Qo'noS.[78] Helps defeat General Chang over Khitomer.[51] Ship aboard which Tuvok serves as science officer.[78] Commanded by Captain Styles in Star Trek III: The Search for Spock and Captain Hikaru Sulu in Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country.

Excelsior.name: USS Farragut
Excelsior.depiction: Transported several genetically enhanced humans to Deep Space Nine.[79][80]

Excelsior.name: USS Fearless
Excelsior.depiction: Assigned to planetary mapping in the Beta Mahoga system.[23] Received new warp technology[19] Briefly seen in The Next Generation Episode " Where No One Has Gone Before"

Excelsior.name: USS Fredrickson
Excelsior.depiction: Briefly at Utopia Planitia Fleet Yards.[81] Serves in the Dominion War.[25]

Excelsior.name: USS Gorkon
Excelsior.depiction: Sent to face a possible Borg invasion.[17]

Excelsior.name: USS Grissom
Excelsior.depiction: Assists the Enterprise-D during a contamination problem on Beta Agni II. Name pays tribute to astronaut Gus Grissom, commander of Apollo 1.[82] Destroyed at the Battle of Ricktor Prime.[83]

Excelsior.name: USS Hood
Excelsior.depiction: William Riker's assignment before his transfer to the USS Enterprise-D.[84] Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6] Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9[85] and First Battle of Chin'toka.[86] Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.[87]

Excelsior.name: USS Intrepid
Excelsior.depiction: Responded to a Klingon distress call from the Khitomer outpost following a Romulan attack.[88]

Excelsior.name: USS Lakota
Excelsior.depiction: Commanded by Captain Erika Benteen. Attempts to stop USS Defiant from reaching Earth under the orders of the rogue admiral James Leyton.[89]

Excelsior.name: USS Malinche
Excelsior.depiction: Commanded by Captain George Sanders. Patrolled the Cardassian Border before the Dominion War. Severely damaged by the Maquis led by Michael Eddington.[90] Destroyed in 2381 during the Borg Invasion.

Excelsior.name: USS Melbourne
Excelsior.depiction: Offered to William Riker to command.[21] Starfleet flagship at the Battle of Wolf 359, where it is destroyed.[21]

Excelsior.name: USS Okinawa
Excelsior.depiction: Ship commanded by Admiral James Leyton and ship on which Benjamin Sisko served as first officer[1][91]

Excelsior.name: USS Paris(Simulation ship)
Excelsior.depiction: Simulated Excelsior class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

Excelsior.name: USS Repulse
Excelsior.depiction: Katherine Pulaski's assignment before the USS Enterprise-D.[92] Served in the Dominion War.[38]

Excelsior.name: USS Roosevelt
Excelsior.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21][93]

Excelsior.name: USS Valley Forge
Excelsior.depiction: Damaged by an orbital defense platform at the Battle of Chin'toka.[86]

Freedom.name: USS Concorde
Freedom.depiction: Assigned near the Romulan Neutral Zone in an alternate timeline.[94]

Freedom.name: USS Firebrand
Freedom.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21]

Freedom.name: USS Mesquite
Freedom.depiction: Training ship, assigned to Star Base 001. mentioned in Star Trek: Tactical Assault.

Galaxy.name: USS Challenger
Galaxy.depiction: Witnesses the return of USS Voyager to Earth.[95] Commanded by Captain Geordi La Forge in an alternate future.[96]

Galaxy.name: USS Cortez
Galaxy.depiction: Referred to by Chief O'Brien and Captain Sisko during the mission to retake DS9.[97] Lost patrolling Cardassian border[98]

Galaxy.name: USS Dauntless
Galaxy.depiction: First ship under players command in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Destroyed while escorting a transport by Cardassian ships.

Galaxy.name: USS Enterprise
Galaxy.depiction: Primary setting for Star Trek: The Next Generation. Captained by Jean-Luc Picard. Launched in 2363. Destroyed in 2371. Engineering section destroyed by warp core breach at Veridian III. Saucer section crash landed on Veridian III and rendered unsalvageable.[77]

Galaxy.name: USS Excalibur
Galaxy.depiction: Commanded by Captain Mackenzie Calhoun, primary setting for the latter part of Star Trek: New Frontier as successor to the Ambassador class ship of the same name.

Galaxy.name: USS Galaxy
Galaxy.depiction: Pathfinder. Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9,[85] First Battle of Chin'toka,[86] and Battle of Cardassia.[64] Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.[87]

Galaxy.name: USS London
Galaxy.depiction: Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.[85]

Galaxy.name: USS Musashi
Galaxy.depiction: Mentioned in the conversation of log transcription for Graviton Stabilizer by Ensign Nog.[32]

Galaxy.name: USS Odyssey
Galaxy.depiction: Sent to rescue Benjamin Sisko from the Jem'Hadar. Destroyed in the rescue attempt.[99]

Galaxy.name: USS Robinson
Galaxy.depiction: Taken command of by Benjamin Sisko after the Borg Invasion of 2381 in the novel Star Trek: Typhon Pact - Rough Beasts of Empire.

Galaxy.name: USS San Francisco
Galaxy.depiction: Minor supporting vessel in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Fate uncertain.

Galaxy.name: USS Sarek
Galaxy.depiction: Replaced USS Cortez in formation during operation to retake DS9[34]

Galaxy.name: USS Trident
Galaxy.depiction: Commanded by Captain Elizabeth Shelby and later Captain Kat Mueller in Star Trek: New Frontier.

Galaxy.name: USS Trinculo
Galaxy.depiction: Part of the Starfleet Armada tasked with retaking Deep Space 9 from Dominion control during 'Operation Return' (DS:9 episode "Sacrifice of Angels")

Galaxy.name: USS Venture
Galaxy.depiction: Part of a Starfleet task force at Deep Space Nine during the Klingon invasion of the Cardassian Union.[100] Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9[34][85] and the First Battle of Chin'toka.[86]

Galaxy.name: USS Yamato
Galaxy.depiction: Crew discovered Iconian artifacts but is infected by a computer virus that causes antimatter containment loss.[102] The virus causes the ship to explode with all hands lost. Commanded by Captain Donald Varley.

Galen.name: USS Galen
Galen.depiction: Prototype, commanded by Commander Clarissa Glenn. Part of the Project Full Circle in the Star Trek: Voyager relaunch novels.

Hokulea.name: USS Tripoli
Hokulea.depiction: Discovered Data.[103] Later assigned to Qualor II.[104]

Intrepid.name: USS Bellerophon
Intrepid.depiction: Transports Federation personnel to a summit on Romulus.[105] Flagship of Vice Admiral Ross during parts of the Dominion War.

Intrepid.name: USS Intrepid
Intrepid.depiction: Pathfinder vessel. Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.[87]

Intrepid.name: USS Pathfinder
Intrepid.depiction: Captain Christine McDonald's new command in the book Star Trek: Preserver. Destroyed in battle with USS Enterprise (NCC-1701-E) and Ferengi Marauder-class starship Leveraged Buyoutaround planet Halkan.

Intrepid.name: USS Voyager
Intrepid.depiction: Primary setting of Star Trek: Voyager : (TV Series) . Commanded by Captain Kathryn Janeway. Commanded by Captain Chakotay in the "Enemy of My Enemy" book series, then commanded by Captain Afsarah Eden in the novel Unworthy, then by Captain Chakotay as final commander in the novels Full Circle and Children of the Storm.

Intrepid.name: USS Liberty
Intrepid.depiction: Part of Battle Group Omega sent to intercept Reman warship Scimitar.[87] Commanded by Captain Carl S. Bouchillon.

Intrepid.name: USS Sally Ride
Intrepid.depiction: Designed for deep space exploration and scientific discovery. It is the third ship in the Intrepid-class, having been commissioned at the same time as the USS Voyager. It has a cruising speed of warp 6 and a maximum sustainable speed of warp 9.975. Its armaments include ablative armor and quantum torpedoes. Commanded by Capt. Rafael Martinez. It appears in the Geek & Sundryweb show Shield of Tomorrow.

Istanbul.name: USS Constantinople
Istanbul.depiction: Suffered a hull breach transporting colonists to Gravesworld.[106]

Istanbul.name: USS Havana
Istanbul.depiction: Scheduled to rendezvous with the Enterprise-D in 2369.[107]

Istanbul.name: USS Sarajevo
Istanbul.depiction: Lost in the Gamma Quadrant in 2371.[108] Later recovered and served in the Dominion War.[38]

Korolev.name: USS Goddard
Korolev.depiction: Delayed rendezvous with the Enterprise-D after the Acamarian Truce's signing.[109] Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Korolev.name: USS Korolev
Korolev.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Luna.name: USS Luna
Luna.depiction: The prototype for the Luna-class. The ship was destroyed by a catastrophic engine failure before the events described in the novel Taking Wing of the Star Trek: Titan novel series took place.

Luna.name: USS Titan
Luna.depiction:
The USS Titan is the first command of Captain William Thomas Riker, former first officer of the USS Enterprise-D and USS Enterprise-E.[87]A Luna-class starship, designed primarily for scientific discovery. Described as 450 meters long, the Titan was built with state-of-the-art science facilities as opposed to being a more tactically pronounced starship. With a complement of about 350 persons, the USS Titan comprises the most racially diverse crew in Starfleet, with less than 15% of the population being human, as well as a number of non-humanoid beings.
A full set of schematics of the USS Titan is available in the novel Sword of Damocles of the Star Trek: Titan novel series.

Luna.name: USS Callisto
Luna.depiction: Captained by Admiral Trenton Cole, a long time friend of Picard's.

Luna.name: USS Rhea
Luna.depiction: Captained by Captain Bazel, a Saurian.

Luna.name: USS Charon
Luna.depiction: Captained by Bellatora Fortis and destroyed during the novel Sword of Damocles of the Star Trek: Titan novel series.

Luna.name: USS Krakatoa
Luna.depiction: Captained by Bartholomew Stavisky, a long time friend of Benjamin Sisko. Last command was USS Illinois NCC-12512 States class.

Magee.name: USS Shran
Magee.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars

Malachowski.name: USS Clarke
Malachowski.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle at the Binary Stars

Mediterranean.name: USS Lalo
Mediterranean.depiction: Reports a "hiccup" in time that resulted from Dr. Paul Manheim's experiments.[110] Destroyed by the Borg.[111]

Merced.name: USS Merced
Merced.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Merced.name: USS Trieste
Merced.depiction: Fell through a wormhole during Data's tour of duty.[112] Stationed near Starbase 74 when the Enterprise-D is hijacked by the Bynars.[113]

Merian.name: USS Curie
Merian.depiction: Commanded by Captain Xin Chan. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

Merian.name: USS Hawking
Merian.depiction: Commanded by Captain Bal Itak. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

Merian.name: USS Merian
Merian.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Merian.name: USS Planck
Merian.depiction: Commanded by Captain Hosc T'Mar. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

Miranda.name: USS Aephas
Miranda.depiction: Featured in the tie-in novel Star Trek: Seekers #4: All That's Left.

Miranda.name: USS Brittain
Miranda.depiction: Crew went insane due to loss of REM sleep.[114]

Miranda.name: USS Lantree
Miranda.depiction: Crew died after exposure to genetically engineered humans. Destroyed by the USS Enterprise-D.[92]

Miranda.name: USS Majestic
Miranda.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle for Deep Space 9.[85]

Miranda.name: USS Nautilus
Miranda.depiction: Participates in the First Battle of Chin'toka.[86]

Miranda.name: USS Reliant
Miranda.depiction: Ship on which Pavel Chekov serves as first officer.[115] Assigned to Project Genesis and later hijacked by Khan Noonien Singh.[115] Destroyed by Genesis Device detonation.[115]

Miranda.name: USS Saratoga
Miranda.depiction: Ship aboard which Benjamin Sisko serves as first officer.[12] Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[12]

Miranda.name: USS Saratoga
Miranda.depiction: Replaced previous Saratoga; little else known.[citation needed]

Miranda.name: USS ShirKahr
Miranda.depiction: Destroyed in the First Battle of Chin'toka.[86]

Miranda.name: USS Sitak
Miranda.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle for Deep Space 9.[85]

Miranda.name: USS Tempest(simulation ship)
Miranda.depiction: Simulated Miranda class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

Miranda.name: USS Tiananmen
Miranda.depiction: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6] Went MIA while patrolling the Cardassian border during the Dominion War.[116] Participates at the First Battle of Chin'toka.[86] Named for the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989.[117]

Miranda.name: USS Trial
Miranda.depiction: Part of a Starfleet task force at Deep Space Nine during the Klingon invasion of the Cardassian Union.[100] Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.[85]

Miranda.name: USS Samuel B. Roberts
Miranda.depiction: Part of the Starfleet task force during the final battle of the Dominion war.[64] It was brought out of mothball status just two months before the final battle after having been extensively updated. It was badly damaged in the battle but survived. It was later decommissioned again and then scrapped after being deemed too far damaged to repair and mothball again.

Miranda.name: USS Lynx
Miranda.depiction: The Lynx was a troop transport during the Third Klingon And Federation War. She was later destroyed in a skirmish with a couple of Klingon Birds Of Prey, with all hands lost.

Mulcibier.name: USS Achilles
Mulcibier.depiction: Commanded by Captain Tillum Drafar. Part of "Project Full Circle" in the Star Trek: Voyager novel Full Circle.

Nebula.name: USS Bellerephon
Nebula.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[12]

Nebula.name: USS Melbourne
Nebula.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359. Remains of ship visible in aftermath of the battle in Star Trek: The Next Generation episode "The Best of Both Worlds, Part 2". Registry and name same as Excelsior class ship seen in Star Trek: Deep Space Nine pilot episode "Emissary"[118]

Nebula.name: USS Bonchune
Nebula.depiction: Sent to recover the USS Prometheus.[119]

Nebula.name: USS Endeavour
Nebula.depiction: Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6] Participates at the Battle of Sector 001.[2]

Nebula.name: USS Farragut
Nebula.depiction: Helps recover Enterprise-D crew at Veridian III. Destroyed in the Lembatta Cluster by Klingons.[120]

Nebula.name: USS Hera
Nebula.depiction: Disappeared while under the command of Captain Silva La Forge with a mostly Vulcan crew of 300.[121]

Nebula.name: USS Honshū
Nebula.depiction: Destroyed while transporting Gul Dukat to stand trial.[30]

Nebula.name: USS Leeds
Nebula.depiction: Participates in the Battle for Deep Space 9.[85]

Nebula.name: USS Lexington
Nebula.depiction: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.[2]

Nebula.name: USS Merrimack
Nebula.depiction: Transported Sarek from Legara IV to Vulcan.[122]

Nebula.name: USS Monitor
Nebula.depiction: Sent to the Romulan Neutral Zone in anticipation of a possible Romulan attack.[123]

Nebula.name: USS Nebula
Nebula.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Nebula.name: USS Phoenix
Nebula.depiction: Carries out unauthorized attacks on Cardassian ships while under the command of Captain Benjamin Maxwell.[124] Not specified whether she's named for the mythological bird, the American city, or humanity's first FTL-capable spacecraft.

Nebula.name: USS Prometheus
Nebula.depiction: Used by Dr. Gideon Seyetik in his project to reignite a dead star.[125]

Nebula.name: USS Proxima
Nebula.depiction: Missing in the Gamma Quadrant.[108]

Nebula.name: USS Ranger
Nebula.depiction: Lost during the Borg invasion of 2381, the vessel was defending the planet Khitomer.[126]

Nebula.name: USS Sutherland
Nebula.depiction: Briefly commanded by Lieutenant Commander Data while part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Nebula.name: USS T'Kumbra
Nebula.depiction: All-Vulcan crew challenges the Deep Space Nine crew to a game of baseball. Participated in the Dominion War.[127]

Nebula.name: USS Ulysses
Nebula.depiction: Studied protoplanetary masses in the Helaspont Nebula.[128]

Nebula.name: USS Nightingale
Nebula.depiction: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Used as a search-and-rescue vessel. Fate uncertain.

Nebula.name: USS Khitomer
Nebula.depiction: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Leads a failed assault on Alioth 6. Fate uncertain.

Nebula.name: USS Berkeley
Nebula.depiction: Minor starship in Star Trek: Bridge Commander. Originally sent to study the Vesuvi Dust Cloud but fails due to the intense radiation of the dust cloud. Attacked by a Kessok probe but survives. Fate uncertain.

New Orleans.name: USS Kyushu
New Orleans.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21]

New Orleans.name: USS Renegade[1]
New Orleans.depiction: Rendezvous with the Enterprise-D over Dytallix B, where Captain Tryla Scott meets with the Jean-Luc Picard to discuss an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet.[11]

New Orleans.name: USS Rutledge[1]
New Orleans.depiction: Ship aboard which Miles O'Brien[129] and Benjamin Maxwell served during the Cardassian War.[124] Participated in the counterattack against the Klingons in the Archanis sector.[120]

New Orleans.name: USS Thomas Paine[1]
New Orleans.depiction: Rendezvous with the Enterprise-D over Dytallix B, where Captain Rixx meets with the Jean-Luc Picard to discuss an alien conspiracy to take over Starfleet.[11] Part of the tachyon blockade during the Klingon Civil War.[6]

Niagara.name: USS Princeton
Niagara.depiction: Destroyed at the Battle of Wolf 359.[21]

Niagara.name: USS Wellington
Niagara.depiction: Ship aboard which Ro Laren served, and where she was posted before being court-martialed.[130] Underwent a computer system upgrade by Bynar technicians at Starbase 74.[113]

Nimitz.name: USS Europa
Nimitz.depiction: Participates in the Battle at the Binary Stars in 2256

Norway.name: USS Budapest
Norway.depiction: Participates in the Battle of Sector 001.[2]

Norway.name: USS Norway
Norway.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Nova.name: USS Equinox
Nova.depiction: Stranded in the Delta Quadrant.[131] Heavily damaged by USS Voyager and destroyed by self-destruct initiated by Captain Ransom.[131]

Nova.name: USS Everett
Nova.depiction: Commanded by Captain Claudia Alisov. Attached to the Department of Temporal Investigations. Appears in the Department of Temporal Investigations novels.

Nova.name: USS Lionheart
Nova.depiction: Medical vessel temporarily commanded by Christine Vale in the novel Star Trek: The Fall - The Poisoned Chalice.

Nova.name: USS Twilight
Nova.depiction: Starfleet Intelligence attached Science vessel temporarily commanded by Jaryd Harker MD in the novel Star Trek: Adamant - .

Nova.name: USS Nova
Nova.depiction: Presumable namesake ship for the class.

Nova.name: USS Rhode Island
Nova.depiction: Commanded by Captain Harry Kim in an alternate future.[132]

NX.name: Enterprise
NX.depiction: Lead ship. Captained by Jonathan Archer. Primary setting for Star Trek: Enterprise. Launched in 2151. Decommissioned in 2161.

NX.name: Columbia
NX.depiction: Commanded by Captain Erika Hernandez.[133] Launched in 2154 and participated in Klingon-Augment crisis. After an uncertain term of service, It was eventually lost but was later discovered Intact on a desert planet in the Gamma Quadrant. Fate of crew unknown.[133]

NX.name: Challenger
NX.depiction: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

NX.name: Discovery
NX.depiction: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

NX.name: Atlantis
NX.depiction: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novel The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing.

NX.name: Endeavour
NX.depiction: Mentioned in the Star Trek: Enterprise novels The Romulan War: Beneath the Raptor's Wing and The Romulan War: To Brave the Storm. Later entered Federation Starfleet service and rebuilt into Columbia class.

NX.name: Intrepid
NX.depiction: Commanded by Jason Lambert. Mentioned in the Star Trek: The Next Generation novel Indistinguishable from Magic.

NX.name: ISS Enterprise
NX.depiction: The Mirror Universe counterpart of the Enterprise (NX-01).[134]

NX.name: ISS Avenger
NX.depiction: In the Mirror Universe, an Imperial Starfleet warship.[134]

Oberth.name: USS Banting(simulation ship)
Oberth.depiction: Simulated Oberth class vessel used by Academy trainees in Star Trek: Starfleet Academy.

Oberth.name: USS Biko
Oberth.depiction: Rendezvouses with the USS Enterprise-D at Deinonychus VII.[135]

Oberth.name: USS Bonestell
Oberth.depiction: Destroyed in the Battle of Wolf 359.[12]

Oberth.name: USS Cochrane
Oberth.depiction: Ferries Admiral Norah Satie to the Enterprise-D.[136] and Julian Bashir and Lieutenant Jadzia Dax to Deep Space Nine.[12]

Oberth.name: USS Grissom
Oberth.depiction: Transports David Marcus and Lieutenant Saavik to the Genesis planet.[43] Destroyed by Klingons.[43] Named for NASA astronaut Virgil I. "Gus" Grissom who died during preparations and testing for the Apollo One mission. Commanded by Captain J. T. Esteban

Oberth.name: USS LaGrange
Oberth.depiction: Transports negotiators in the game Star Trek: Starfleet Academy. This ship is destroyed by the simulator.

Oberth.name: USS Oberth
Oberth.depiction: First ship of the class. Assigned to deep space exploration in 2293, when "Operation Retrieve" was proposed.[51]

Oberth.name: USS Pegasus
Oberth.depiction: Equipped with an illegal prototype cloaking device that malfunctions, causing the ship to become embedded inside an asteroid.[75]

Oberth.name: SS Tsiolkovsky
Oberth.depiction: Crew infected by the Psi 2000 virus. Destroyed in asteroid collision.[137]

Oberth.name: USS Valiant
Oberth.depiction: Helps recover Enterprise-D crew at Veridian III.[77]

Oberth.name: USS Yosemite
Oberth.depiction: Studied the plasma arc between binary stars.[138][139]

Oberth.name: SS Vico
Oberth.depiction: Research vessel that was in service with Starfleet in the mid-24th century. This ship was on loan to a civilian agency, and was given a civilian registry. Vico operated out of Starbase 514. In 2368, the Vico explored an astronomical formation known as a black cluster. Found derelict by Enterprise-D.[140]

Odissey.name: USS Enterprise
Odissey.depiction: Commanded by Captain Va'kel Shon. Participates in the second battle for Deep Space Nine as well as the final battle against the Iconians in Star Trek: Online.[citation needed]

Odissey.name: USS Houston
Odissey.depiction: The Houston, commanded by Admiral D'Vak, leads the federation in an assault against the Borg Queen's Octahedron in the space around the Unicomplex.[citation needed]

Odissey.name: USS Odyssey
Odissey.depiction: First ship of the Odyssey-class. Commissioned at Utopia Planetia. Currently in service.[citation needed]

Odissey.name: USS Yorktown
Odissey.depiction: The Yorktown fought at the battle of sol in the Iconian war, and was nearly destroyed. It was later found by Starfleet and refitted into the Yorktown subclass of the Odyssey class starships.[citation needed]

Odissey.name: USS Hamilton
Odissey.depiction: The Hamilton fought in many skirmishes along the Klingon border during the Third Klingon And Federation War. She later fought in the second battle of DS9 alongside ships like the USS Enterprise. The Hamilton was a major component during the Iconion War. She was later destroyed in a ‘’hurq’’ Attack at ‘’DS9’’.[citation needed]

Odissey.name: USS Kent
Odissey.depiction: The Kent was a ship of exploration in the early 25th Century. She later went missing during the Iconion War. Two years after she went missing, a fragment of her hull was found adrift in the Ba'Aja sector,The rest of the ship was later found in the Boreth Sector in 2429.[citation needed]
